content.description: This is a fairly stright forward climb. Obvious left facing corner that starts about 10ft up the wall. Takes good small cams for the lead
content.protection: Small cams and trees for the anchor
content.location: Hiking uphill on the NCT from the north side, the route is on the left just off the trail.

content.description: Just like the aproach trail this one is usually pretty dirty! With more traffic this could become a great beginer lead.
content.protection: Trees for top rope anchor, Standard rack for lead
content.location: Just left of the trail same approach as "North Counrty Corner"

content.description: The North Country Trail Spur area has great access right off the trail. It has a few roped climbs but the main attraction of the area is the long vertical to overhaging bouldering cut. As of this writing there have been no climbs done on the cut but as the informations get out it shold be on any serious boulder's radar. Being that it can be accesed from the Harlow Lake Pathway it could be part of an amazing boulder circuit!!!Â
